Anisotropy – Acceptor only, donor only, and double labeled \",\"type\":\"align-justify\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"ets0c\",\"text\":\"b.     FRET efficiency folder (“efficiency” for short) \",\"type\":\"align-justify\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"f3tqc\",\"text\":\"b. steps.section: Processing .hdf5 files for burst analysis and FRET
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"em4cu","text":"Enter pathname and run +protein sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q97p","text":"       Make sure beta is set so that the double labeled population median is at 0.5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"erj9n","text":"In the “FRET Efficiency” folder you created, go to the individual FRET Efficiency .csv file ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dhpo0","text":"Add up the number of bursts that had a FRET Efficiency above and below 0.5 from the “E” column in the .csv file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ghke","text":"a.     =IF(F5454\u003e0.5,1,0)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bogp","text":"b.     This will assign 0 below 0.5 and 1 above 0.5 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ac49t","text":"Sum the number of bursts that had a FRET efficiency above 0.5 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqgfv","text":"a.     =SUM(N2:N5454)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jfn","text":"b.     This will be the numerator for your high FRET efficiency bursts ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8nlcu","text":"Determine the number of bursts (sum the number of rows of data) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hc5c","text":"a.     =ROWS(N2:N5454) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3fig","text":"b.     This is your denominator ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7v8h9","text":"Determine the proportion of bursts above 0.5 – this is proportion high FRET","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkh6p","text":"a.     Sum of bursts above 0.5 / sum of total bursts ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9kiag","text":"Determine the proportion of bursts below 0.5 – this is proportion low FRET ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fq07","text":"a.     Sum of bursts below 0.5 / sum of total bursts ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f518t","text":"Burst Analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4eok7","text":"The output will be called “BurstSearch.txt.”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d3b40","text":"Copy the entire text file contents to an excel sheet ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7v40g","text":"Copy the bursts for acceptor only, double labeled, and donor only ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"rf8","text":"Determine the proportion of these bursts by taking the quantity of these individual burst populations over the quantity of bursts in the RNA only sample ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7t69g","text":"Normalize the RNA only sample to the maximum annealing proportion of 0.75 (for the RNA used in Yanas PNAS 2014 paper). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a9vpo","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"","height":0,"id":444581,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"text/x-python-script","originalFile":{},"original_name":"Anisotr_DDX2b_fig.py","placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/py.png","raw_source":"","size":0,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/puffbi85x.py","type":5,"width":0}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bgj0v","text":"In Spyder - Use program: Anisotr_DDX2b_fig.py","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"99g13","text":"Enter pathname (make sure you separate the files into AO, DO, DL) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cc0om","text":"Determine the t shift, G, and time period that fits the decay curve of the RNA only sample:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d04n6","text":"a.     The G value should bring the decay curve to zero ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2t1ns","text":"b.     The t shift should align the beginning of the horizontal and perpendicular anisotropy decays.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abgi1","text":"c.     The time period should begin when the data is less sparse in the decay curve and end when the curve has flatlined  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tasa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cih9q","text":"Use the “G” “e” “T” commands to set these parameters.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9ibv","text":"a.     For example: type “G”, enter, then “1” (as your G value), enter. You have now set the G factor. Repeat for the other parameters.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6poe0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65ums","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b445p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":203,"id":444740,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"5vt20\",\"text\":\"Example time resolved fluorescence anisotropy\\ncurves.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":53}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"46ulu\",\"text\":\"(Left) RNA only curve for a double labeled RNA. The anisotropy decay\\nshould come completely to zero. All parameters have been set correctly for this\\ntrace. (Right) RNA and protein curve showing high anisotropy. The parameters\\nwere set with the RNA only sample and used for this sample. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pukgbi85x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pukebi85x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pukfbi85x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pukdbi85x.webp","width":257}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"61q34","text":"Apply these values to the +protein and +protein/ATP samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bt0ep","text":"Stop program and enter pathname for +protein samples","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fesnk","text":"a.     Use the “G” “e” “T” commands to set these parameters.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4rvt2","text":"The values will be saved to SavedData.csv file ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cjb8i","text":"Determine B/B0 by using the anisotropy of the tightly bound protein only sample as B0 and using the B value column as B. Plot these values over time to observe anisotropy changes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ef71m","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6c37p","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"qoto","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"","height":0,"id":444590,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"","originalFile":{},"original_name":"FCS_AnalY4_All_B.ipynb","placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/file.png","raw_source":"","size":0,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pufqbi85x.ipynb","type":5,"width":0}},"1":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"","height":0,"id":444591,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"text/x-python-script","originalFile":{},"original_name":"PlotResults1.py","placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/py.png","raw_source":"","size":0,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pufrbi85x.py","type":5,"width":0}},"2":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"","height":0,"id":444592,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"text/x-python-script","originalFile":{},"original_name":"PlotResults1_SPADS.py","placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/py.png","raw_source":"","size":0,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pufsbi85x.py","type":5,"width":0}}}}

title: Multi-parameter confocal TCSPC spectroscopy analysis
